caption: This spot gives excellent service and delightful menu. My favourite spot in the city. The food and drinks arrived quickly and the rates are reasonable. Recommended.
The best ramen I’ve ever had! The wait staff is always very pleasant, due to covid the wait time is much lower so you can grab a quick bite.
I get to eat here a lot since I work right next to it. I like how the service is always fantastic and they keep the place clean at all times. Rates are affordable and they serve big portions.
One of the best Ramen places around. Great portion sizes, quick, and delicious
First time there and very impressed! Delicious.
Everything very good, I loved it ..... I'll be back more often.

Pandemic Review - my boys and i were in the mood for Ramen. The place is clean and the tables are divided by plastic see through walls. I got the Spicy Miso Ramen with ground pork and extra noodles.  Taste: overall it was delicious. Perfect amount of spicy and ground beef. I would order an extra side of spicy if you want more of a kick, but my nose started running so that's how I know the spice was just right 😏.  My boys got the house Ramen and were not happy with the broth flavor. Something was off for them ( no enough flavor, missing some ingredient). We eat ramen often, so I take their judgement pretty fairly.  Still try the place out. It will help your palette suggestion
Would surely recommend trying this place. Great character, delicious dishes, excellent customer service. 5 stars.

The house ramen is passable but the soy sauce ramen has a root beer aftertaste. It feels bad just typing that but it's true, we couldn't even finish our bowls. The service was nice and the seating was ample but big pass
While there are some Japanese ramen stores in Boston and Cambridge, Sapporo Ramen provides the best ramen.
Good food at affordable prices.
If you love spicy, you have to try this. It’s so different than the other ramen I had. Ask for spicy oil on the side, you won’t be disappointed

two days ago was the first time we came to that fine restaurant. But It is no doubt not the last. We passed a splendid evening with the excellent service, with the fine cooking and fine drinks and with the comfortable price. We will surely visit there in a short time.
Customs Service was extremely good. We got a variety of ramen and they were all delicious. Would recommend you come here.
Delicious ramen in a huge portion and a not huge price.  Highly recommend if you like ramen
Average ramen, small menu, good for a quick bite

Best ramen in Cambridge/Somerville. Tan tan men has such a complex flavor that leaves you satisfied long after the meal is done. I also love how during COVID they store the ramen noodles separately and leave enough room in the broth container to combine the two.
Delicious broth and very tender pork. Would recommend.

Ramen here is always good.  There gyoza ispan fried perfectly everytime.  It's a must try.  The tian tian mein is very thick soup based.  They make one of the most flavorable ramens around Boston area.
This is one of the best ramen in town. Very Sapporo’s style ramen. It’s so good, their Kara-age is very good too, love it!
Had a very good experience in this spot with my son. The food comes out quickly and the customer service is just great. Prices are fair.
Love the ramen. The place is kinda small but you guys can always request to sit outside

This place is surely one of the finest restaurants in the area. Always when I go there I am profoundly pleased. They preserve their high  level service and the highest level of cooking  they offer. You definitely will enjoy this this restaurant. Highly  recommended.

By far the best ramen I've had in my life. This place is great! I wish I could go back every day, it is too bad that I don't have an infinite amount of money to spend at this kind of establishment. If you get the chance I recommend that you go here as soon as possible you won't regret it.
Throwback picture @ Sapporo Ramen Dated 16th May 2012
The best ramen I’ve ever had. Been coming here since 2012.
I always arrive buying some food here. I love the rapid service and well made food. Fantastic work.
The Spicy Miso Ramen is oh so good! Don’t be fooled - not all ramen is the same, if the  business name is. This gem is in Porter Square💎
My favorite place to go and get my delicious maki don ... They alway nice and good customer service. Affordable n cute litw place
This spot never fails to deliver. They have fresh food for affordable rates, there no long wait even when the place is packed.
we ordered the food and it smelled so bad, it seems it had gone bad, the miso ramen and the spicy miso ramen smelled really bad and were tasting funny
Tantan ramen is my absolute favorite here. If you want something hearty, this is the way to go.
My favorite ramen! I will always come here over any other ramen spot. I love it, spicy miso ramen w/ extra noodles, get the gyoza, I love this place seriously. It's never disappointed.
I always stop by getting some food in here. I liked the rapid service and well prepared food. Kudos.

The OG Boston ramen shop for a reason. The broth is incredibly rich and flavorful. I like to ask for a bit of grated garlic to put in the broth about halfway through - it really changes it up and adds another dimension to the already delicious dish!
Great ramen.  There's often a line, though it moves quick enough.  Food is well worth the wait.

Excellent ramen. Very consistent and tasty. Today we called in for take-out and requested they not cook the noodles. Odd request, but they were ok with it. We were transporting the soup to NH, and wanted everything to be fresh! The raw noodle servings were individually packaged and we boiled them for 2 minutes each. (For anyone reading, 2 minutes is enough. You really don't want to overcook them!) Reheated the soup and served with homemade soft boiled eggs. Couldn't ask for better! Thank you Sapporo, you made it possible to have wonderful ramen in the backwoods of NH!
Not authentic cuisine
Very good, but very small!

It's a little unexpected to come into a big office building and find a small collection of restaurants serving various types of Asian food.  Sapporo Ramen was pretty good- it's kind of like going to a food court but you have to wait in a small line in the hallway to be seated since there are only 10 tables.  The food is good- with a very small menu. You have six bowls of ramen to choose from and you can spice up your bowl with condiments. The pork in the ramen was tender but it could have been a bit better.  There are a handful of appetizers as well - we had the Gyoza and it was good. All and all, I would eat here again if I was in the neighborhood but it's not in my top 5 ramen  shortlist.
Nothing better than a bowl of spicy miso goodness on a cold winter day!
Delicious - the broth in their House Ramen has all the umami of a soft boiled egg, and was absolutely fantastic. The pork was rendered perfectly and the price can't be beat.
The service is always fast, great vibes, nice employees. I will eat here again when I arrive in the area.

I visit this place a lot since I work right next to it. I have to say their service is always excellent and they keep the spot well kept constantly. Rates are affordable and they serve sizeable portions.
Small, cozy, busy with delicious Ramen!!!!
One of my favorite Ramen soup place
House ramen for the win!

Small place, that can fill-up during peak periods. Has a few (not so many) good ramen dishes. I would recommend the house speciality. Not a great drinks selection so you might want to get your drinks elsewhere beforehand.

Have had more bowls of ramen here than anywhere else in the world! I've hit ramen shops everywhere from Tokyo to, LA, SF, and NYC and always get excited to come back here. Super solid really awesome homey ramen.
(Translated by Google) You will find the best Ramen, very delicious.  (Original) Encontraras los mejores Ramen, muy deliciosos.
Delicious! Always worth it.
O-M-G. If I died tomorrow my life is now complete. Bless you Sapporo Ramen, food of the gods🌟✨✨✨✨✨✨✨✨✨
The absolute best place to get ramen if you haven't been definitely try it out. and the spicy miso pork ramen is one of all time favorites.
Perfect, authentic ramen. Get the extra seaweed.
The broth is very rich, the meat is very tender, ramen is also great! The price is so worth!
(Translated by Google) Unsavory soup, worthless  (Original) うまみが無いスープ、並ぶ価値無し

Great Ramen and low prices. There's often a line, but it's worth the wait. They'll also take your order when you're still in line, so the food comes quickly once you're seated. If you like pork buns, be sure to order theirs; they're excellent. The homemade broth in the noodles is also really good.

This was my first ever experience to authentic ramen and it will always hold a special place in my taste buds. I love the flavors of ramen they have. The noodles are fantastic and the broth is just outstanding. It's small so be ready to wait in line to get a seat but it's totally worth the wait.
Love their noodles the soup base is thick and creamy.
Great ramen. The wait might be long but it's worth it.
I like it
THE BEST ramen around. No questions. Very small place but totally worth any waiting you may experience.

Delicious! It's very tiny, just like all the other places within this little food court type area, so there is usually a wait. We went on a Friday night at about 7pm and had maybe a 30min wait? The ramen was very good! My husband had the house ramen and I had the hot and sour ramen (pictured) - very good, great flavor, I even finished it all! My husband said the house ramen was pretty good but that he'd try another one in the future. I saw someone's vegetarian ramen that looked very good, as well. For $10-11 it's a very good deal. No alcohol, which also helps keep your dinner bill down, I suppose.

I really enjoyed my ramen here! I can understand why Sapporo would be overshadowed by the hype of Yume down the street, but I think this place should have its own following! There's quite a few options on the menu and its located in a bustling campus center. The portions are big too
Perfect portions, cozy atmosphere, and cheap. You can't beat that!!!!!
Best Ramen noodles around, great broth and fair prices
Fantastic food. The curry ramen is really good and flavorful, and the portions are large.
Not your typical ramen!!

Sapporo is a great spot I've been ratting for years. Always delicious and hits the spot. Nestled beneath Lesley its a great place for a post class decompression and feast. The spicy miso is a favourite for me the heat, though not overwhelming, is flavorful. Don't forget to order extra noodles if you're extra hungry it makes the difference.
Some genuine authentic hand made ramen by good people. Highly reccommend!!! 😎
Good ramen with thick broth, tasty pork, and chewy noodles

Absolutely awesome first experience! We chose to come to Sapporo on a whim because we would be in the area. With no concept of where it was, we were shocked to find it inside of a Mall. Sapporo is tucked away in a narrow alleyway inside of the mall. With only about a dozen or so seats, this just added to the whole experience!  We were fortunate enough to beat the line and be seated right away. The staff were extremely friendly with no feeling of being rushed, despite the line building up behind us.  The menu is very simple; a few appetizers and about 8-10 bowls or ramen. The menu has a few photos which makes choosing a dish, a little bit easier.  We started with Gyoza. The dumplings were flavorful and crispy... would get again!  The house ramen was light and loaded with three thick cuts of pork. The second bowl of ramen we had ordered was the Spicy Miso. This was amazing! Thick broth, covered in chili oil, ground pork, corn and bean sprouts.  Overall, awesome first experience and I will definitely be back! (Potentially one of my new favorite restaurants in Cambridge)
Great Ramen and service!
With the price of $10.00 for a bowl of ramen, quality and quantity, I'll just keep going to eat there as long as they're in business.
Been going here since high school. Lovely staff, delicious ramen and a great time. Now they take card!
The hot n sour ramen is amazing and prices reasonable
The house ramen here was quite good. Nice size portions with good broth.
this is my very favourite ramen place- it has excellent broth and its noodles are perfect. the ramen is very big so you can always share it, i would recommend the house ramen :)
You can really taste all the flavorings from the broth.
It is delicious but ramen soup is too salty.

Honestly, this place is just amazing. The food is consistently amazing, the service is friendly and accommodating, and for one of the best bowls of ramen around their prices are amazing. If you don't know what to order get the spicy miso Ramen and a side of pork buns.
Does not serve Ramen after 2pm.
Their spicy miso ramen is awesome
Easily one of the best meals I've ever had. I often make the 2 hour drive down just to get a bowl of the house ramen.
Great, delicious ramen. Consistency of quality. Flavorful.
Great ramen spot! It's very all and limited seating so I would suggest getting there 15 minutes before they open if you want to seat and eat, otherwise order take out.
Great food, great service! Can be a little crowded and the water could be filtered a little better, but overall a nice spot to have lunch or dinner.
(Translated by Google) I always have a long line, but I feel that the Japanese tongue is a bit thin.  (Original) いつも長い列が出来ていますが、日本人の舌には少し薄味ではないか、という気がします。
One of the best ramen shops around. It's not fancy by any means, but it's one of the most comforting and authentically amazing spot where one can eat delish ramen!
Somewhat bland broth

One of the best places to get some hot ramen soup. They do a great job. But if you come during lunch it it busy. You have to wait in line. Like most things waiting in line is totally worth it. My google reviews Have been too short so I have to tell you more as a para Ramen soup base is full of natural collagen and you can’t miss it in the Porter Square
IRoast pork buns we're great, tender meat and soft buns (maybe a little coleslaw). Ramen was excellent. Tan-tan was not over spicy, it was just right. Worth the wait.

We have tried MANY ramen places and Sapporo is by far our favorite. I have never had and doubt I will ever have ramen that compares to the quality of Sapporo and it's very fairly priced. I cannot speak highly enough about Sapporo
Love their ramen noodle soup.

Mediocre ramen spot. The place is small but even still the wait was maybe 15 minutes. The broth was very lackluster and not hearty. The egg was merely half of a hard boiled egg. Okay spot if you're just looking for a ramen fix.
Not impressed. From the egg (simple hard boiled egg) to the broth (it's maybe only me but it feels like they added some water later on) all is very mediocre.

They're always busy because it's tucked away in a college, but the ramen broth is almost always perfect. I only wish they were located in a more convenient place and had more visibility outside of the school. This place is the true definition of "hole in the wall." Delicious, so good, but hard to find.  One of my favorite places to get authentic ramen.

Very good ramen with not much wait time, located inside Porter Square inside Lesley University (about a 3 minute walk from the station). One of my favorite roasted pork bun in the area because the pork is very big as oppose to some places that gives you a thin slice.  Their broth is cooked for 10 hours before serving so the flavor is very strong, though could be a bit salty depending on which one you order. I find the Spicy Miso spicier than the House Ramen.
Best ramen in town
Delicious little ramen spot. The waitress was super sweet, the ramen was tasty and the wait wasnt too long for a weekend.
Always a great experience here the ramen is the best !!!!

My favorite Ramen place in or around Boston! They have traditional ramen soup, amazing apps, and a small number of entrees. Best known for their ramen; house and tan tan are outstanding! A must stop if you are a fan of ramen. Note: there are limited seats (around 14) and gets packed after 12 pm
Best ramen!
Really rich broth for house ramen and miso ramen! Good price
The best ramen in the world. Rich broth.
Great food! Good spot!
Ooooh this place is addictive. I deliberately travel into Boston for their ramen

I've been coming to this place for years and the food is always good. The place is always crowded. It's a very small place. They have a good system. They take your order while you wait in line, so when you sit your order comes very quickly. I usually get the hot and sour soup. The hostess/waitress is very nice. I highly recommend this place.
Solid ramen.
I got food poisoning from the house ramen, and I have what my friends call "a cast iron stomach."
If you want to try the best Ramen in Boston you have to come here.. period
My favorite place to get my favorite meal.
Very good ramen soup, great service, decent prices. Will come back for more delicious ramen!
One of my favorite venues for ramen. I stop in at least once a week.
Great pork bao (buns)! The ramen is also one of the best in all of boston. It is very small so there is a wait but it is very worth it.

It was a bit packed when I visited but you definitely have to come here at least once if you like ramen to any capacity. It wasn't the best ramen i've had around here but the house ramen I ordered was still pretty tasty. I love a decent tonkotsu style ramen.
Amazing noodles, every single tine
Pretty good ramen a bit pricey.

If you come here during dinner time, expect to wait at least 10-15 minutes before you get seated. It's a small joint so you might have to share a table. The staff is nice enough for a hole in the wall like this. I've had the curry ramen, spicy miso ramen, and hot and sour ramen. The portions are large and generally cheaper than most ramen spots. The curry ramen was a little bit of a disappointment as the broth is really thick and not that curry like. The spicy miso and hot and sour ramens were great! However, I once had a taste of my friend's house ramen and you should definitely consider going simple. As most ramen places, the broth is on the saltier side. My only regret here is that the ramen toppings sometimes seem just "tossed in" versus purposefully seasoned or chosen.
Ramen at its best
We had a shockingly good, very cheap meal here. Highly recommended.
My favorate place for Ramen!
Small place you'll likely have to wait. Tasty ramen, come hungry and ask for extra noodles
Great ramen. Cheap and quick for a to-go meal.

Man we love this place. The regular house ramen is the best ramen I've had. Definitely get here early, because there's always a line at the end of the hallway. But don't let the line turn you away. They do a great job of taking orders while customers are in line, and having their food ready practically as they sit down.
Their broth is so awesome and different from all the other ramen places that we have tried. The lady that served us was also so nice and sweet! 5 stars totally recommend!
Delicious tangy Tan Tan.
My favorite ramen place in town.
Always very good!!!
The service is awesome and the ramen is good! Very convenient location as well!!
Consistently great ramen and friendly service. It's often busy, and you might be asked to share a table, but that's because it's really good and everyone wants to eat here!
Wow! Just wow! Spicy ramen was so good, I will definitely be back.
This is one of metros hidden gems. So damn good and inexpensive you'll think there's a catch. There isn't.
Every broth is based in pork. No vegetarian options.

The house ramen is one of my absolute favorite dishes ever. Such a great savory and flavorful broth and great noodles/fillins too.  Get the spicy ground pork in it and it makes it so much better! As the weather gets cooler this is going to be a go-to stop more often. Service staff is super nice too!
Always delicious, always packed. Get here when they open or bring something to do when you're standing in line. Try the roast pork buns and the house ramen (I like it with extra veggies)

Small ramen shop in the Lesley mall. Extremely good service, very prompt.   We had the pork buns, house ramen, and vegetarian ramen. The buns had big pieces of tender, fatty pork. Both types of ramen were fresh and filling. The vegetarian ramen had plenty of umami and lots of veggies. The portions were generous.
Love it. Be prepared for a line, but if you like ramen, it's worth it.

Ive been going to sapporo ramen for years. I hadnt been there for awhile, but something happened.  I am so saddened that they are no longer a ramen place. Not sure if changed owners but i live ramen and have had ramen all over the world . Sapporo used to be a top pick. I will never go there again. I never give reviews. But now i have no place in Massachusetts i can say has great ramen. Goodbye Sapporo
Widely known as a great ramen place. Go when the universities are on holiday
I've been coming here for the past 5 years, never had a bad experience, ramen is always amazing, will be coming for another 5 years and more.
I cannot think of any other place that serves ramen noodles this good.

I had their house Ramen. Great broth, great noodles. Great service. Very kind staff. There was a small wait like 5 minutes, but we looked at the menus while waiting. They have probably 10 2 person tables or so, but if there are bigger groups there might only be space for 4 parties, etc.

I got a Spicy Miso Ramen. While the spiciness is a bit more than my comfortable range, I especially liked the rich soup of the ramen. The soup was especially creamy. May be next time, I should just get the Miso Ramen and enjoy the soup more.
Great food and service
Just okay. We waited in line for a while know this is "the place" to go, but all four of us were pretty underwhelmed with the Ramen.

Love this place.  If you get there 15 mins before they open you'll get seated as soon as they open.  I think their ramen is one of the best I've had in Boston.  I always get extra noodles and I can barely finish the bowl.
Nice soup!
Excellent ramen! Worth waiting in line for.
Love this place, have been coming here for years and it’s consistent, delicious ramen.
This place does pretty good ramen, though I prefer nearby Yume wo Katare (or even closer Yume ga Arukara for udon).
A bit crowded - small place and small menu but the ramen is excellent
Love it, always great! We travel from RI to go as often as possible.
A wonderfully rich broth.  I try to eat here once a month.  My favorite is the house ramen with kimchi.
First time there, had the spicy miso ramen. Broth was rich and delicious. Come early, we arrived 15 minutes prior to dinner on a Sunday and were 4th in line. Definitely coming back!
This is the best ramen I’ve ever had: great broth, great noodles, etc. Highly recommend!
Great food. Some vegan options. Shoyu ramen is great!
My kids love this place.  There are tough critics
Spicy miso ramen. Really liked it!
Been here twice, both by myself and shared a table with another solo diner.  Probably the second best but still very good Ramen in Boston/Cambridge.  Best in Porter Square.
This place is amazing, good food, good prices. I'd never wait in a line anywhere else but here. 5 Big ass stars!
Not the thick pork broth I'm used to but a very delicious and light broth. The noodles were good. The pork pieces were sweet, thick, and tender.
Delicious, friendly and warm
Miso ramen so good it should be illegal.
It was so great!! Try it!

Although seating here is limited and there is often a wait time, I highly recommend this place! Their Ramen is my favorite in the Boston area. My two young children usually split a bowl because the portion is so big! I love the setting in Japan Town (mall), located inside The Shops at Potter.
Ramen is way overpriced, pork Katy's curry was ok and employees were unfriendly and rude!! Not going there again!
fast n good
Very friendly staff and friendly entree pricing.

The ramen was relatively good. I enjoyed it but it's not my top ramen spot. I got the House Ramen which I figured should be their top dish since it's a classic. The egg wasn't slightly runny in the center (which I find really important in Ramen) and the soup was a bit too thick/egg-y. The pork also wasn't super amazing/tender/fatty/flavorful but it also wasn't bad. It's in one of the stalls inside Lesley University, so don't expect a large, well-decorated restaurant. Wait wasn't too bad on a weekday night at 8pm, we got seated right away though we did have to share a table.

The house ramen is delicious! Prices are affordable. The soup is definitely one of the better ones, and the pork is so well-marinated. There is limited seating, so you will have to wait in line in the busier hours.
This ramen place is king for their broth. My personal favorite ramen I have had in Boston!
I love this place!! Been coming here for 15 years. I love this ramen better than the ramen I had in Tokyo
The house ramen is a wonderful traditional broth, so full of protein and flavor I found myself taking breaks. I got it with kimchi, which adds a nice sour tinge to the savory richness.
The best Ramen I have had to date. There is always a line to dine here. The quality food, friendly service, and reasonable prices make this one of the best places to get your Ramen fix!
Best ramen, love the wait: gives you time to talk and make friends.
We've been in line for 50 mins and still waiting. Their ramen is pretty good though.
My favorite ramen in Boston. There's usually a line peak hours, but if you go outside of those times there usually isn't a wait.
Worth the wait. Try the Pork bun.
The lines are long but if you like authentic ramen, you can't beat Sapporo.
Best ramen in the Boston area!
Food was good, make sure you have cash.
I think Yume is better
I've been going here since 2012 and I've never had a bad dish. Worth every penny and then some.

Not good. We've been to a lot of Boston's ramen restaurants, and this was by far our least favorite. Ajitama came out unacceptably overcooked, and one of the broths we received split into a literal half INCH of vegetable oil. It was gross. Just go down the street to Yume, or brave the red line one stop and go to Santouka. Only saving grace was the noodles, which were admittedly well cooked and springy, but not worth it overall. To be fair, our server was friendly and understanding, but with so much good food around, we won't be going back.
Fantastic ramen. There is almost always wait but it's absolutely worth it. Rich tasty base. Great toppings. Go for it!
Will get Shoyu Ramen without pork next time. Be humane people!

Sapporo Ramen was definitely worth the wait. Expect long lines and the hassle of this place being cash only (there's an ATM right around the corner) but when you get your ramen you'll know you made the right choice. I've had both the spicy miso and tan tan and both were out of this world.
Best ramen ever
Loved the hot noodle soup. Great service. The worst thing is you have to wait in a line to get a seating.
The food was delicious.
At first I was in love, but since I've had way better ramen. Try Little Big Diner in Newton! They are the ramen kings around here.
Good Ramen for 10.00 a bowl

We visited here because we read that it was popular and this place was always crowded whenever we wanted to visit.  We got a chance to actually eat here late one night and managed to order the famous ramen bowl.  I guess our expectations were too high as while the ramen was good, it wasn't outrageously good that we would wait in line all the way out in the lobby area for.
Fantastic thick broth ramen. Fast. Cheap.
House ramen, so good!

A fabulous ramen place.  I got the Spicy Miso Ramen and it was to die for.  A friend told me this place was one of the first ramen places to appear in Boston!  That's awesome.  Worth it, and totally affordable.  I think my bowl of ramen was about $9~.
Fast and tasty ramen
A staple with perfect execution: bare bones tables serving large bowls of delicious ramen.
Best ramen in Boston
Absolutely the best ramen I've had. Cash only but it's worth it.
Great food but did not say they were closing at 8:10 even when I called and they said they were open until 9 pm.
I always get the same thing: spicy miso ramen. It's so good, I can't stay away from it.
Very good
Good place to get Ramen. I like it better than Yume Wu
Good food Good people Good service
One of the Best if not the best Ramen places in Boston
Best authentic ramen in the area. Spicy miso is to die for.
Best ramen in town imho
This place is worth the wait.  The best ramen I've ever had.
Great staff. Great ramen. Unpretentious and clean.
Simply savory, delicious ramen. Some of the best around

This is by far hands down the best ramen to be had in the Boston area.  They make a chicken-based broth and have 2 pieces of char siu to go with the ramen.  My go-to dish is typically the house ramen or kimchi ramen.  t's affordable compared with Santouka, which while good is a bit on the pricey end.  This is a cash-only place and they don't take reservations.  Go early if you want to get a seat.
Usually packed you have to wait in line
Probably the worst Ramen that I have ever had - noodle, soup and the thick cut pork (yes, a thick cut compared to the normal one) are all way too bad.  How come the rating is so high?
Excellent authentic ramen with delicious broth and REAL fresh noodles.
Great authentic ramen in a food court style location
Excellent Ramen!
Compared to other Ramen places, Sapporo Ramen is pretty subpar.  I have been to this place, every time the quality of the ramen seems to diminish.  Their best ramen is definitely the tan tan men
Best ramen I've had in Boston out of the handful of places I've tried. Can be pretty busy!
Nice comfort food.
Decent Ramen place. There will be a line sometimes tho
The dish tan tan men is my favorite noodle dish.   Lots of sesame flavor.
Not so good Ramen. Not sure why others give high mark

If you're looking for a welcoming and upscale dining environment, look again. If you're looking for fantastic ramen, look no further. I love ramen, and I try it at any place that I'm recommended to try. This has been my favorite by far, even better than the outstanding Yume Wo Katare down the road - to think we only tried here because they were closed! We both had the spicy miso ramen, and it was absolutely fantastic. I will have to come back with a completely empty stomach, because the portion was far too much to finish otherwise. Too many options on the menu to try, but the ones I've had have been outstanding.
Best ramen in the Boston area. The broth is amazing. Worth the wait in line. Definitely a no frills, bare bones, ramen place.
Skip the line by ordering it to-go and eating it in the mall, sitting on the floor with your friends.
This place was packed when all the neighboring restaurants were empty. That says something
Love the ramen here!

Best ramen in Cambridge, hands down! While Yume Wo Katare (also in Porter Square) offers a great experience (they clap their hands when you finish, you can say your dream, etc.), Sapporo Ramen offers just the most authentic, savory Japanese ramen experience I've ever had outside of Japan.
One of the best ramen places around, really lives up to the hype and the long line is well worth the wait.

One of the best ramen in greater Boston, and maybe the longest running ramen that is currently open! I prefer the shoyu broth. They have excellent vegetarian options. Limited seating, so you may be asked to share a table if you dine alone, but service is very fast and the staff are friendly. Located inside of the Porter Exchange mall.
Best ramen in Boston/Cambridge! VEGAN FRIENDLY - order the vegetarian (vegan) ramen with rice noodles. My wife and I go every week. Great food, great price, friendly and efficient staff.
Great ramen that isn't too heavy and is reasonably priced. Not a lot of seating but if you go at the right time they are very fast.
Decent ramen for Boston, but not the best. Get here right when it opens because there's usually a long line.
Best comfort ramen noodles
Delicious
We showed up 15 minutes before opening on a Saturday and didn't have a problem getting a seat.  I had some spicy Ramen with extra noodles.
I would give 3.5 stars based on 1st experience. Spicy ramen is pretty good but doesn't have the wow factor. Takes cash only.
Love the food

The owners are so friendly and their ramen is delicious. My favorite is the spicy miso ramen (very spicy). They do not do delivery but call 10 minutes in advance and they'll have whatever you want available for pickup! Not too expensive and the portions are huge.
The only Vegetarian Ramen in Boston that is worth waiting for. Small, cash only restaurant with great food. Get the extra noodles in your Ramen.

I was simply amazed on what this little restaurant could cook. The broth and flavor was outstanding.  It is very small and expect to wait for a few minutes to get a table.  The buns were a good price and good for two people that were eating some ramen.  Cash only, but that wouldn't stop me to go another time when in the area.
Very limited seating but the ramen was good. Comparable to the other places in the city like Santouku

It's hard to judge ramen because everyone has their own preferences in terms of broth. This particular ramen place makes very thick, creamy broth which I think is pretty good. The contents of the ramen are all standard and cooked okay, really just depends on your preference as I said before.  Only real downside is how tiny this place is and the line/wait that's always there.  The wait is usually like 40 minutes, but it sucks because you actually have to stand there the whole time. Definitely would recommend it if you come on an off hour, otherwise it might not be worth the wait if you're not into the kind of ramen.

It's small so there's usually a wait but the service is good and I've never been disappointed with the ramen. It's my favorite in the area. I recommend the yasai ramen, which comes with more veggies than the others.
Delicious! Mouth is salivating just thinking about the ramen here.
Not as good as Yume Wo Katare down the street, but still an excellent bowl of ramen! Soup and noodles were great, but the egg half on top was cold and awkward.
I am still waiting for the ramen, after placing the order 45 min ago. Wish I could honor them a zero star.

My boyfriend *loves* Ramen. So when we went to Boston for a visit, he found a few Ramen places he wanted to try. We were only supposed to go here once, but ended eating here 4 times before our week-long trip was up.  Both the vegetarian and House broths were *amazing*, and being able to switch between ramen noddles and rice noodles for a change was a really nice touch.  I was not a huge fan of Ramen going in, but Sopporo has changed the way I think about this dish. I still dream about the food here from time to time.
spicy miso ramen.

I have been eating here since I was a kid and it has always been the best ramen I have ever had. I live about an hour away now and I still make the trip on a regular basis to get my ramen fix. The price is great and the line is always worth the wait. Thank you for serving the best ramen around.

If you're up for a crazy crowd and experience, this could be the place for you. The ramen was good, but not outstanding-- so after the long wait and the limited menu-- I wasn't thrilled with the place. It's not a relax and eat dinner type of place. It's a place to go with a crowd, eat quickly and be done. Decent ramen, but hard to enjoy in the chaotic space.

On a bone-chilling, rain-filled day, I embarked on a hunt for foods to warm me up. What do I want? My fingers start typing my desires. "Soup." No. "Noodles." Not quite. Something that combines them both. "Ramen." Amen.  Following the address listed, I find myself at Porter and am so very confused. It looks like I'm at the right place, but where is this mysterious Ramen den? After sketchily walking up and down the block a few times, I figure out the hidden entrance: you go in through the Shops at Porter door. I had no idea this place was essentially in a Japenese food court! And what a food court it is.  I went a bit after the lunch rush (around 2:30 PM) so was surprised to see a line of about 5 people all waiting for a seat at the tiny, packed Sapporo. With the other Asian restaurants in the hallway completely deserted. I felt a bit bad for them, but that means that Sapporo is the place to be. And I'm already here, so shivering and hungry, I wait.  After about 20 minutes, I'm seated and order a Spicy Miso Ramen. Luckily it comes out in a jiffy, steaming and spicy and savory. And so, so perfect. There are noodles and pork and veggies in a delectable broth. If it weren't freezing outside, I probably would have broken a sweat as I slurped.  Honestly, I can think of nothing better on a rainy day than this bowl of Japanese love. I scarfed down as much as possible, my mouth and belly thanking me again and again, but still wasn't able to finish it. Even better! I get it packed up and have a scrumptious lunch the next day.  Ramen. Amen.
Absolutely love this place.  The House Ramen and gyoza are both fantastic and worth waiting in line for. I live down the street and have to resist going every week for my noodle fix.
Very good ramen, price is just right. Wouldn't go anywhere else for authentic ramen!

With limited options in Boston, Sapporo Ramen is my go to. Waits can be long, and the pork is on the tougher side. But the broth and the noodles are great. House and miso broths are on the thicker, coat-your-lips side, which I like. No thin broths for me! I appreciate Yume's, but it's heaviness is not my bowl of ramen...haha...

The ramen here is ok. It hits the spot but certainly wouldn't be the best ramen you'll ever have. Both LA and New York have much better ramen, but even within Boston I would recommend Yume wo Katare or the genius hour ramen at Backbar. It's not that cheap either, in fact I think it costs more than Yume. Come here if it's convenient.

No sure if it's worth going again.  I ordered Spicy miso ramen with additional pork.  Their noodles were too much soft and soup was spicy without any taste nor Umami.  They had posters in Japanese but I don't think who knew real Japanese Ramen would serve such Ramen.

This is the perfect place to go on a cold grey day. Fortunately for Sapporo Ramen, we get lots of those in Boston.  Forget the rice dishes and appetizers that clutter up the menu. The gyoza are shriveled and oily, the fried rice dishes are small and are lacking in ingredients other than rice, and the pork bun is lackluster.  Only only ONLY order the ramen here. I usually go for the House Ramen ($8.50, I think) which consists of a simple and hearty broth (delicious and creamy), lots of ramen noodles (chewy -- yum!), beansprouts and corn, half a boiled egg (sadly, this is not the delicious runny and half-boiled egg that you'd find in Japan) and two (ONLY TWO) slices of pork.  The broth and the noodles are the stars of this show. The portion of meat in each bowl, however, is ludicrous. Sapporo even has the nerve to charge $2 for extra pork. I am also saddened by the very well cooked egg...the half-boiled egg is always the best part of ramen!  At the end of the day, though, I like this place because I always leave full and toasty warm.  P.S. This restaurant is cash only! There's a Bank of America (and a couple of other ATMs) right next door, though.
Nice place for Ramen

I can think of nothing bad to say about this place. It's tiny, there are like 5 tables, they only take cash, and somehow it all feels charming. The food is just outstanding. It is exactly what I want out of ramen, every time.

Pure unadulterated joy in a huge bowl of fresh, awesome, and authentic Ramen. This place is a dive -- it's not at all fancy -- you'll eat like a king for less than $10. But note -- they changed the menu a few years ago and the new menu is not nearly as good as the old one... alas... things change ...  (note: they have veg broth which can be rare @Ramen shops) --

This place feels like Asia -- a little noodle shop in a Japanese Mall in the middle of Cambridge.  The noodles are great.  There is one veg option, but you can get them to adapt other ones.  There is always a line, but the service is great.  They come out and take orders from the line, so by the time you get a table, your noodles are ready.

One of the few places in Boston that offers thick broth salt ramen, the taste was okay, but there's something in the broth that disturbed me a bit, therefore the rating is not as high. The serve was filling. Waitress didn't speak to us much and has a pretty strong accent. I won't category it as a restaurant, it's more like a 10 min quick lunch place. Limited seating.
Hot and sour ramen!
